result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mari L Caster

defendant.name: Caster, Mari L
defendant.address: c/o Workforce Development Center 874 Collins Rd, Jefferson, WI 53549

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att Nelson

[ma] Case called at 1:58pm (Court Reporter Nicole Claudon) 
Defendant Mari L Caster appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond.
recess 2:00 pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 11/10/22 at 9:30am
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
